name: realistic-typewriter.js
tagline: A library for simulating typewriter effect in the browser
body:
# realistic-typewriter.js A library for simulating typewriter effect in the browser. ![Demo](https://github.com/fardjad/realistic-typewriter.js/raw/master/gfx/demo.gif) ## Usage var tw = typewriter(targetDomElement).withAccuracy(90) .withMinimumSpeed(5) .withMaximumSpeed(10) .build(); tw.clear() .put('$ ') .waitRange(1000, 2000) .type('whoami') .put('
') .wait(2000) .put('realistic-typewriter.js', function () { console.log('yeah'); }) .put('
') .waitRange(500, 1000) .put('$ ') .waitRange(1000, 2000) .type('exit', function () { console.log('finished'); }); ## Showcase Did something interesting with **realistic-typewriter.js**? Tweet [me](https://twitter.com/therealfardjad) about it! ## Installation You can use this library with [browserify](http://browserify.org/) or download a pre-compiled version (see below) from the project's [releases page](https://github.com/fardjad/realistic-typewriter.js/releases).
build/typewriter-bundle.js is the browserify bundle.
build/typewriter-bundle.min.js is the minified version of the browserify bundle.
build/typewriter-bundle-sa.js is the UMD browserify bundle.
build/typewriter-bundle-sa.min.js is the minified version of the UMD browserify bundle.
